curam.util.persistence

Class RowManager<I,S extends DeepCloneable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.persistence.RowManager<I,S>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - the object type used as the key to a row. Typically a primitive or boxed type, rather than the generated Key struct. Must be immutable and have a natural implementation of Object.equals(Object) and Object.hashCode().
    S - the generated struct containing fields corresponding to the columns on the physical database table.

    public class RowManager<I,S extends DeepCloneable>
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages a row of data for a physical database table.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected RowManager()
      Constructs a new manager for a row of data.
        RowManager(RowInfo<I,S> rowInfo)
      Constructs a temporary row manager to enable access to a row of data.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RowManager

        protected RowManager()
        Constructs a new manager for a row of data.

      • RowManager

        public RowManager(RowInfo<I,S> rowInfo)
        Constructs a temporary row manager to enable access to a row of data. Temporary row managers are not added to the cache.
        Parameters:
        rowInfo - Information about the data row (including the data itself).

    • Method Detail

      • databaseInsert

        public void databaseInsert()
        Attempts to insert a new row of data onto the database. Entities with newly-inserted database rows are added to the entity cache.

      • databaseModify

        public void databaseModify()
        Attempts to modify an existing row of data on the database. The row is only passed to the database if it contains any unsaved changes.

      • databaseModify

        public void databaseModify(int versionNo)
        Attempts to modify an existing row of data on the database, with the version number specified. The row is modified on the database regardless of whether it contains any dirty data, in order to ensure that the version number is incremented.
        Parameters:
        versionNo - The version number of the row being modified.

      • databaseRemove

        public void databaseRemove()
        Attempts to remove an existing row of data from the database. Entities with removed database rows are removed from the entity cache. Note that after removal, the entity will still bear its old ID. A removed entity can be reinserted into the database but will typically have a new ID generated.

      • getDtls

        public S getDtls()
        Gets the row of data being managed by this row manager. For snapshots, a disposable copy of the original dtls are returned instead. The row is read from the database if it has not already been read previously.
        Returns:
        An instance of the generated dtls struct which holds the database column data values for the row being managed.

      • getID

        public final I getID()
        Gets the ID of the row being managed.
        Returns:
        The ID of the row being managed.

      • getOriginalDtls

        public S getOriginalDtls()
        Gets a copy of the database row as it was last read from/written to the database. Can be used to determine which (if any) of the RowManager.dtls are "dirty" (i.e. not yet saved to the database). The row is read from the database if it has not already been read previously.
        Returns:
        A copy of the database row as it was last read from/written to the database.

      • isDirty

        public boolean isDirty()
        Indicates whether the row being managed contains any unsaved changes.
        Returns:
        Whether the row being managed contains any unsaved changes.

      • isOnDatabase

        public boolean isOnDatabase()
        Indicates whether this row is present on its physical database table. May be useful to validation logic which might need to branch depending on whether the row is being inserted or modified, e.g. setter validation which only allows a field to be set at insert time, not at modification time.
        Returns:
        Whether this row is present on its physical database table.

      • setRowInfo

        public void setRowInfo(EntityManager<?,?,?> entityManager,
                       RowInfo<I,S> rowInfo)
        Sets up for managing a row of data.
        Parameters:
        entityManager - The entity instance for which this row manager will manage the data fields.
        rowInfo - Information about the data row (including the data itself).
